title: Foundation: Language Skills & Historical Knowledge
description: Complete your O/L or A/L. A passion for Sri Lankan history, culture, and nature is essential. Crucially, develop proficiency in English and, if possible, another foreign language (e.g., German, French, Chinese).
skills: Knowledge of Sri Lankan History & Culture
institutes: Language courses at British Council, Alliance Fran√ßaise, etc.

title: Professional Training & Licensing
description: Enroll in a tour guide training program at a recognized institute. To work as a National Tour Guide, you must obtain a license from the Sri Lanka Tourism Development Authority (SLTDA), which involves training and an examination.
qualifications: National Tour Guide License from SLTDA
institutes: SLITHM (Sri Lanka Institute of Tourism & Hotel Management)

title: Gaining Experience as a Freelance or Company Guide
description: Start working as a licensed guide. You can work as a freelancer, finding clients through personal networks or online platforms, or join a major travel and tour company that will provide you with regular tours.

title: Specialize and Build a Niche
description: Differentiate yourself by specializing in a niche area. This could be adventure tourism (hiking, rafting), wildlife and nature tours (bird watching), cultural and archaeological tours, or luxury travel.
qualifications: Specialized certifications (e.g., in wildlife, adventure sports)

title: Tour Operator / Own Travel Company
description: Leverage your experience, network, and reputation to move beyond guiding and start your own tour operating business. This involves creating tour packages, marketing them internationally, and managing all logistics, including guides, transport, and accommodation.
qualifications: SLTDA registration as a Travel Agent
